title: 105_s243
content: The Act titled "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" temporarily reinstates airport and airway trust fund taxes. The fuel tax rate specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to be 4.3 cents per gallon for aviation gasoline after specific dates. The fuel tax rate for aviation gasoline is amended to be 4.3 cents per gallon after specific dates, with corresponding changes to tax periods and terminations. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended various sections related to ticket taxes and transfers to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, with changes effective until September 30, 1997. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended section 9502(f) to terminate the Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate with taxes imposed after September 29, 1997. Floor Stocks Taxes on Aviation Fuel were also addressed. A floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by any person on a tax-increase date. The liability for the tax lies with the person holding the fuel, and payment must be made as prescribed by the Secretary on or before the first day of the 7th month after the tax-increase date. The floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel must be paid by the person holding the fuel on the tax-increase date, which is 7 days after the enactment of the Act. Payment is due on the first day of the 7th month after the tax-increase date. The floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel must be paid by the person holding the fuel on the tax-increase date, which is 7 days after the enactment of the Act. The tax does not apply to aviation fuel held exclusively for certain uses for which a credit or refund is allowable for fuel purchased after the tax-increase date. No tax is imposed on aviation fuel held on the tax-increase date if the aggregate amount does not exceed a certain limit. On the tax-increase date, a person must pay a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel. The tax does not apply if the aggregate amount of fuel held does not exceed 2,000 gallons. Exempt fuel and controlled groups are also considered for tax purposes. All persons in a controlled group are treated as one group, with the definition of a controlled group based on ownership of more than 50 percent. Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, principles similar to those of clause (i) apply to a group of persons under common control where one or more of those persons is not a corporation. All provisions of law applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code also apply to floor stock taxes imposed by paragraph (1) to the same extent as if imposed by section 4091 of the Code. The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. SEC. 3. Taxes collected during taxable period to be transferred regardless of when paid. Amendment to Section 9502(b) of the Code states that any amount received in the Treasury after specific dates shall be treated as received on the day before such date. The amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
